result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontreill T Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 AMENDED FROM THEFT-MOVABLE PROPERTY FROM PERSON/CORPSE, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  All other court costs are waived.
Defendant must attend school and obtain high school diploma.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Dontreill T Davis in court with attorney Nhu H Tran.  Defendant Dontreill T Davis in custody.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams for Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Defense requests that cash be modified to $1500 cash bond. The State objects.

Defendant Dontreill T Davis in court with attorney Nhu H Tran.  Defendant Dontreill T Davis in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Not sure if defendant is SPD eligible.
BTC:   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant. No contact with gang members.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780). Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dontreill T Davis in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Dontreill T Davis in custody.  W R Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.
